2020 film by directed by Kaare Andrews

Sniper: Assassin's End is a 2020 American action film directed by Kaare Andrews and starring Chad Michael Collins, Tom Berenger and Sayaka Akimoto.[1][2] The film is the eighth installment of the Sniper film series and a sequel to Sniper: Ultimate Kill (2017).


Plot[edit]
Special Ops Sniper Brandon Beckett is set up as the primary suspect for the murder of a foreign dignitary on the eve of signing a high-profile trade agreement with the United States. Narrowly escaping death, Beckett realizes that there may be a dark operative working within the government and partners with the only person whom he can trust, his father, legendary Sniper Master Gunnery Sgt. Thomas Beckett. Both Becketts are on the run from the CIA, Russian mercenaries, and a Yakuza-trained assassin with sniper skills that rival both legendary sharpshooters.

Cast[edit]

Chad Michael Collins as Brandon Beckett, a MARSOC Scout Sniper
Sayaka Akimoto as Yuki "Lady Death" Mifune, a Yakuza sniper and assassin
Ryan Robbins as Zero, a DHS operative
Lochlyn Munro as Agent John Franklin
Emily Tennant as Agent Juliet Clover
Michael Jonsson as Drake Phoenix
Vincent Gale as Donald South
Tom Berenger as Tom Beckett, a former USMC Force Recon Scout Sniper
Production[edit]
A hand double with a missing index finger plays Berenger's character in close-ups.[3]

Release[edit]
Home media[edit]
The film was released to Blu-ray, DVD, and digital platforms on June 16, 2020,  and reached #1 on iTunes in September 2020.[4][1][5]
